page.title: 05STOURBRIDGE CHURCHES OLD+NEW
page.content: The newest{church}built in 1983 is St. Michaels Norton.Housing developments demanded a centrally placed church and community centre. The fan shaped{building}is carpeted throughout and has an altar dais.The church can seat over 200 people. St Marys church Old Swinford is the oldest church.A priest was here in 950, 700 years before Stourbridge developed.The first recorded Rector is John in 1199.The{parish}registers are complete from 1602.The old church rebuilt in 1843 has box pews and a gallery.The oldest part is the fourteenth century tower. The fine rectory designed by Wren's pupil Nicholas Hawkesmoor was rebuilt in 1700 and contains beams from the previous Tudor building.{Religion}in Stourbridge spans 1000 years.
